text: Henning Jenson (17 August 1949 – 4 December 2017) was a Danish footballer. He played as a forward. He played for German club Borussia Mönchengladbach, Spanish club Real Madrid, Dutch club Ajax and Danish club AGF Aarhus. He won seven trophies in his club career, including four league titles. He also played for the Denmark national team from 1972 to 1980, scoring nine goals in 21 games. He was born in Nørresundby. Jensen died of a short illness on 4 December 2017, at the age of 68. ==References== ==Other websites== * Henning Jensen at dbu.dk Category:1949 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Danish footballers Category:Disease-related deaths in Denmark
title: Henning Jensen
